Caption: Audience at the 2nd Institute Day
Description: Seated in the first row (first from left) is Prof. Wolfgang Scheer and (third from left) Prof. Koch. Dr. Wolfgang Scheer was born in 1923, and joined IIT Madras at the age of 36 in 1959. He was responsible for much of the progress in turbomachine research in the early days. Dr. Koch was a German Professor of Physics who joined IIT Madras on 3rd July 1959. Koch was born in 1903 at Stralsund. He studied experimental and theoretical physics, mathematics and chemistry from 1923 to 1929. He studied at the University of Greifswald (1923), University of Berlin (1924 to 1925). In 1926, he undertook laboratory work in the Magnetic Department (O. von Auwers) of ‘Siemens Forschungslaborantorium’, Berlin. Following this, he studied at the University of Goettingen from 1927 to 1929. From 1928 to 1929, he prepared a thesis under R. W. Pohl about a comparative microchemical and optical determination of a number of disturbance centres in alkalihalide phosphors. In 1929, he received a research scholarship of the ‘Notgemeinschaft der deutschen Wissenschaft’ (Emergency Association of German Science). He worked as scientific staff, researcher and head of department at various points in his career. He visited Sweden, England and the USA on study tours before joining IIT Madras on 3rd July 1959.
